body: This report is not actionable without a log.
Same error here on Ubuntu 20.04 . previous version worked all right.
Without a session log, we cannot look into this issue. Please provide a session log (Help -> Log Files -> Upload Current Log)
Thank you for your prompt response . this is the log :https://obsproject.com/logs/zlggnAkVG0zUS84o
@danikino In your case, disable Psycho Visual Tuning in Settings -> Output for the NVENC encoder, as the 600/700-series don't support it.

Hello! I'm facing same issue here.
Here is my log, hope this will help ðŸ™
https://obsproject.com/logs/mazhF4kXXRd8wtyZ
Sorry, but i didn't find Psycho Visual Tuning in Settings -> Output.

@Pittan 
Try switching to x264, start a recording/ steeam, stop it and then switch back to the hardware encoder.

> 
> 
> @WizardCM
> Don't think that's possible for the ffmpeg nvenc.
> (Linux)

@Gol-D-Ace 
I thought users could disable Psycho Visual Tuning on Linux since #4477?  @danikino 's issue actually appears to be #4785, NVENC failing on a Kepler GPU if attempting to enable Psycho Visual Tuning.

The original issue here was about macOS, so let's focus on that here.

----

After some testing by others on the team, we believe we know what has happened.  This has to do with changes from #4105.  What appears to have happened is that the user had a previously configured "vt_h264_hw" encoder.  With the changes in #4105, that encoder ID no longer exists in OBS, because we now use Apple's encoder IDs instead of our own internal IDs.  The encoder IDs have changed like this:

* vt_h264_hw -> com.apple.videotoolbox.videoencoder.h264.gva
* vt_h264_sw -> com.apple.videotoolbox.videoencoder.h264

If you manually change the encoder to one of the options in the UI, it should work fine.  We'll look into if we're able to handle this more gracefully in a future update.

@RytoEX 
Looks like I missed that one.
Sorry

In that case yeah it should be possible.

> 
> 
> > vt_h264_hw -> com.apple.videotoolbox.videoencoder.h264.gva
> > vt_h264_sw -> com.apple.videotoolbox.videoencoder.h264
> 
> @RytoEX I do wonder if we can set an alias of some kind so that Intel users automatically get pointed internally to the new encoder ID? Or if it's better to leave this one-time manual reconfiguration..

We can probably check if the encoder ID is an old value and swap it for the corresponding new value.  I don't know for sure.
